sections.title: About
sections.paragraph:
Hi! welcome to my corner of the internet.

I am a back-end engineer with 7+ years experience and DevOps Manager for almost 4 years. As DevOps Manager, my top priority is to maintain the infrastructure stability, monitor cost, release deployment, server right-sizing & manage fellow DevOps Engineers. I enjoy working on technical challenges of all sorts.

items.title: kOps EC2 Update Smoother
items.description: Script written in Ansible to run before & after kops rolling-update. For pre-rolling update, it turn some pods to zero for smooth kops instance increase & kops validate cluster before the server update. For post-kops rolling-update, it brings back the pods after the successful server update.

items.title: GraphQL white-label validation in NestJS
items.description: Automate white-label configuration for new channel partner with AWS CloudFront & Certificate Manager API.

items.title: Airflow 2
items.description: Upgrade Airflow 1 to Airflow 2 then deploy to Kubernetes cluster.

sections.title: Description
sections.paragraph:
I am developing a fully-implanted, wireless, high-channel count brain-machine interface (BMI) with the goal of enabling people with paralysis to directly use their neural activity to operate computers and mobile devices with speed and ease.

Micron-scale threads would be inserted into areas of the brain that control movement. Each thread contains many electrodes and connects them to an implant called the “Link.”

sections.title: Description
sections.paragraph:
Why Mars? At an average distance of 140 million miles, Mars is one of Earth's closest habitable neighbors. Mars is about half again as far from the Sun as Earth is, so it still has decent sunlight. It is a little cold, but we can warm it up. Its atmosphere is primarily CO2 with some nitrogen and argon and a few other trace elements, which means that we can grow plants on Mars just by compressing the atmosphere. Gravity on Mars is about 38% of that of Earth, so you would be able to lift heavy things and bound around. Furthermore, the day is remarkably close to that of Earth.

“You want to wake up in the morning and think the future is going to be great - and that’s what being a spacefaring civilization is all about. It’s about believing in the future and thinking that the future will be better than the past. And I can’t think of anything more exciting than going out there and being among the stars.” - Elon Musk

items.title: Other
items.value: Agile methodologies, test-driven development, UX testing sessions, teamwork
